item.title: Odin for Azure Local: A Community Tool Deep Dive
item.description: Section 1: Introduction Key Points to Cover: What is Odin for Azure Local Who built it (Microsoft, hosted on GitHub) The disclaimer: “provided as-is, without Microsoft support” Why this tool matters for Azure Local practitioners Tool URL: https://azure.github.io/odinforazurelocal/ Current version: 0.12.5 Tone: Honest assessment Not a puff pieceâ€”genuine evaluation Useful for practitioners planning deployments Section 2: Tool Overview What Odin Does: Browser-based wizard/decision tree Walks through Azure Local deployment configuration Generates configuration documentation Generates ARM template parameters Includes a Sizer tool Includes Knowledge documentation The 19-Step Workflow: Step Section Purpose 01 Deployment Type Hyperconverged, Multi-Rack, Disconnected, M365 Local 02 Azure Cloud Commercial, Government, China 03 Azure Region Resource registration location 04 Cluster Configuration Standard, Low Capacity, Rack Aware 05 Cluster Size 1-16+ nodes 05.
